resources.string: Search a game using a game code

Hi!,
 Join me here to play a Rummi game!
 use this code in tha app: %1$s\ or click here
%2$s
Ready to start the game? no more users can join after the game has started
Cannot pick from discard, already drawn
It\'s your turn\nDiscard card or draw
Pick a card to discard first
Pick a card to put in the draw
Sorry, you lost! %1$s won this set!
Sorry, you lost! %1$s won the game!
Select Left or Right for draw the Joker

This is the %1$s set
The game is%2$s full draw

You need to draw this games:

%3$s
Touch anywhere in the preview to close it
It\'s your turn to play in game %1$s
Game will be hidden in the app

GAME RULES


 Rummi is a cards game, it is played with two decks of 52-card poker + 4 jokers, Rummi has several game modes, the mode used in this application is 6-handed game, 6 different hands or sets are played and the Player with the least total points is the winner of the game

 PLAYS:
 During the game two types of Plays can be assembled: Triples And Straights
 Triplets:
 A Triplet, consists of 3 or more letters of the same number or letter regardless of the color, In this version of Rummi, there can be 2 numbers of the same color in a triplet
 Straight:
 A Straight consists of 4 or more cards in ascending order and of the same color. In this version of Rummi, when you reach the top of the straight, you can continue from the bottom, that is, if the straight ends in Ace, you can continue with the number 2

 PLAYS TO ASSEMBLE IN EACH GAME:
 1. A Triplet and a Straight
 2. Three Triplets
 3. Two Triplets and One Straight
 4. Two Straights
 5. Two Straights and a Triplet
 6. Three Straights


 HAND OR SET OPTIONS
 A hand or set can be played in two ways, simple or full draw
 FULL DRAW:
 A full draw hand or set means the player must put together the plays of the hand with all the cards he has plus the card that he has left over to discard
 SINGLE:
 In a single hand or set, the player can draw at any time when he makes the necessary plays of the hand, and continue eliminating cards discarding in games every turn

 OBJECTIVE: The objective of the game is to make the least amount of points in the 6 hands or sets,
 for this, the player must try to run out of cards or with the least amount of points in each hand

 GAME PREPARATION: * Before starting the game, the player who deals the first game, decides which of the 6 hands or sets are full draw

 * The 108 cards are shuffled (including the 4 jokers) * Cards are dealt equally to each player
 For the games from the first to the fourth, 13 cards are dealt, for the fifth and sixth, 15 cards are dealt * The rest of the cards are face down in the middle of the table

 GAME RULES
 * Start the player who dealt the cards by taking a card from the deck

 * The player must get rid of a card that is placed in the discard to the right

 * The next player to the right has the option to take that card or take a card from the deck, In this version of Rummi, each player can only take cards from the discard on their left

 * The player discards a card and all the players continue the same way

 * When a player has made the necessary games to draw his game, when he is on his turn and after taking a card, either discard or deck, he can draw the cards

 * Once the game is drawn, discard a card.

 * If a player has already drawn the game, he can being on his turn without taking a card, discard a card in a drawn game, can be his game or another player's game

 * If the player takes a card from the deck and can draw it into another player's game, he can draw it immediately and then discard a card

 * Once a player has drawn the game, can NOT take cards from the discard again, he can only take from the deck.

 * Before starting the game, the player who deals the first game, decides which of the 6 hands or sets are full draw

 * If a player takes a card from discard, he cannot discard that card in the same turn


 JOKER:

 The joker replaces any card either on a triplet or on a straight
 A game, be it triplet or straight, cannot be discarded only with jokers, it must have at least one card other than the joker

 CARD VALUE:

 * The numbers between 2 and 10, regardless of the color, have the value that the number represents
 * Ace of clubs or spades has a value of 15 points
 * Ace of Diamonds or Hearts has a one point value
 * The letters J, Q, K have a value of 10 points, regardless of the color.
 * The Joker has a value of 100 Points
There is a new application update: version %1$s
